repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/36431 defines "safe" blacklist of Vim files likely to be N/A (at least in practice). I missed some `runtime/` files that were removed a long time ago and some `src/` files that didn't show up until "recently" in v9.x patches.

Starting with test_codestyle.vim since Neovim has `make lint`, specifically `clint.lua`.
Was grepping for `<SNR>` patches.
Unless vim9jit , https://github.com/tjdevries/vim9jit , or similar tool to compile vim9 "test" code into lua, there's no point in trying to make it run within Neovim.

comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -54,18 +54,25 @@ runtime/tools/vim_vs_net.cmd
 runtime/tools/vimm
 runtime/tools/vimspell.sh
 runtime/tools/vimspell.txt
+src/channel.c
 src/hardcopy.c
+src/job.c
 src/mysign
 src/po/ko.po
 src/po/pl.po
 src/po/vim.pot
 src/po/zh_CN.cp936.po
 src/po/zh_CN.po
 src/po/zh_TW.po
+src/term.c

comment_data.body: Is it worth the noise just for one function?

comment_data.body: What noise? The "noise" here is the need to manually check if each N/A patch is actually N/A, so removing this from vim_na_files.txt reduces noise rather than increases it.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -54,18 +54,25 @@ runtime/tools/vim_vs_net.cmd

comment_data.body:
If these files have applicable evalfunc `f_()` functions, then they become applicable.

I am relying on `runtime/doc/` changes to track possible channel/job/terminal features based on the popupwin, sound, etc. features even if the Vim source code is 99% incompatible (1% is for the `f_()` interface).

comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -54,18 +56,28 @@ runtime/tools/vim_vs_net.cmd
 runtime/tools/vimm
 runtime/tools/vimspell.sh
 runtime/tools/vimspell.txt
+src/README.md
+src/blowfish.c
+src/channel.c
+src/dlldata.c
 src/hardcopy.c
+src/iid_ole.c
+src/job.c

 src/po/zh_CN.cp936.po
 src/po/zh_CN.po
 src/po/zh_TW.po
+src/terminal.c
+src/termlib.c
 src/testdir/Make_amiga.mak
 src/testdir/Make_dos.mak
+src/testdir/keycode_check.vim

comment_data.body: IIRC, Nvim never ported Vim's JSON implementation, not even the API for partial compatibility.

comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -119,8 +119,8 @@ TYPES OF "NOT APPLICABLE" VIM PATCHES ~
   supported by Nvim.
     - NA files: `src/Make_*`, `src/testdir/Make__*`
 - `if_*.c` changes: `if_python.c` et. al. were removed.
-- `term.c` changes: the Nvim TUI uses `libtermkey` to read terminal sequences;
-  Vim's `term.c` was removed.
+- most `term.c` changes: the Nvim TUI uses `libtermkey` to read terminal sequences;
